summary:
• Shark attacks are increasing in Australia.
• Technology plays a significant role in stopping shark attacks.
• The use of technology helps reduce the risk of shark encounters.

• Researchers in Canada find ship where Shackleton died
• Celine Dion says 'I'm back' after health struggles

• Chinese women are using AI chatbots like ChatGPT for dating due to their convenience and efficiency.
• These platforms offer an alternative to traditional dating methods, providing users with a sense of control over potential matches.
• The use of AI in relationships raises questions about the nature of human connection and intimacy in the digital age.

• Russia's military presence in Cuba has grown significantly with the arrival of multiple warships.
• The ships will be docked at Havana's port and are expected to stay for an extended period.
• This move is seen as a strategic shift by both nations amid growing global tensions.

• Germany is considering reinstating mandatory national service amidst growing concerns about European security
• The move aims to strengthen military capabilities and contribute to NATO's defense efforts
• National service would require citizens to serve in the armed forces or participate in civilian defense programs

• A US tourist has gone missing on a Greek island
• The individual was last seen several days ago 
• Authorities have launched an investigation to locate them safely

• EU court imposes €200 million fine on Hungary
• Fine is related to Hungary's asylum policy 
• Asylum seekers will likely face more challenges in Hungary due to this decision

• A massive fire broke out at an oil refinery in Iraq.
• The blaze is currently being contained by firefighters and emergency responders.
• There are no reports of casualties or injuries so far.

• Italy's Meloni is being hosted at the G-7 meeting by Western leaders.
• She was elected as Prime Minister after having a successful campaign based on her right-wing policies.
• There were fights going on in the Italian Parliament before the meeting started.

• A police officer shot a magistrate in an open court in Kenya.
• The incident occurred at a local courthouse in Nairobi, capital city of Kenya.
• The motive behind the shooting is still unknown as investigations continue to determine if it was an isolated act or part of a larger conspiracy.

• Hezbollah launches rocket attacks on Israel
• US blames Hamas for prolonging Gaza conflict
• Rocket attacks by Hezbollah target Israeli positions

• New research on ancient Mayan child sacrifices
• DNA analysis reveals surprising details about chosen victims
• Insights into Mayan culture and traditions

• South Africa's ANC is close to forming a unity government.
• The party aims to strengthen its position in the country.
• Mpox has caused two deaths in South Africa.

• A gym in South Korea has sparked controversy with its sign stating that only "elegant" women are allowed to enter.
• The sign's wording has been criticized as discriminatory towards those who do not meet traditional beauty standards.
• Many have called for the gym to remove or modify the sign to ensure equal access to fitness facilities regardless of appearance.

• Evidence suggests that Iran and UAE have supplied drones to Sudan
• This could escalate tensions between Sudanese factions and foreign actors
• Drones may be used for surveillance, intelligence gathering, or even combat

• The US will provide a second Patriot air defense battery to Ukraine.
• A 10-year US-Ukraine security deal will be signed by Biden and Zelensky during the G-7 summit.
• Ukraine pushes the US to supply combat gear despite concerns about its effectiveness.

• UK's Labour leader Keir Starmer has toned down his socialist stance.
• He aims to create a "changed" party.
• This shift marks a departure from traditional Labour values.

•	Trump visits Capitol Hill for first time since January 6 riot
•	Supreme Court rejects challenge to restrict abortion drug access
•	Biden refuses to reduce son's sentence

• A Houthi missile attack severely injured a sailor.
• The US is aware of this incident.
• The attacker was from the Houthi group.
